title: Bieber fever hits Brisbane
text:
BIEBER fever has officially reached Queensland. 
The Canadian singer touched down Sunday night at Brisbane Airport in a private jet. 
Dozens of fans converged at the airport to welcome the pop star ahead of tonight’s concert at Suncorp Stadium. 
And he didn’t disappoint, spending a few minutes chatting with fans from his car before he was taken to his next destination. 
“Thank you for hanging and thank you for waiting,” he said. 
Diehard fan Kate O’Neill, 22, said it was “ridiculously exciting” when the singer pulled up to speak with the crowd of fans. Justin Bieber arrives Brisbane on Sunday night. Picture: Adam Armstrong Source: News Corp Australia 
“I didn’t think he’d stop with everyone,” she said. 
“I think it’s good that everyone sat down and was calm and I think he appreciated that.” 
Fellow fan Tayla Kohler, 23, from Boondall, said she was extremely excited about Bieber’s arrival in the Sunshine State. 
“I’m going to the Sydney show as well as the Brisbane show,” she said. 
“I’m gonna get a tattoo like one that he has.” Justin Bieber arrives Brisbane on Sunday night. Source: News Corp Australia Fans greet Justin Bieber as he arrives in Brisbane on Sunday night. Picture: Adam Armstrong Source: News Corp Australia
